newsitem.title: UK: Carlton weaker on talk of U.S. seller.
newsitem.headline: Carlton weaker on talk of U.S. seller.

text.p: A stock overhang and talk of a U.S. institutional seller pushed shares in Carlton Communications Plc 11-1/2p lower 506 on Tuesday, dealers and market makers said.

"There appears to be a U.S. seller prowling around today," one senior dealer said. "The stock has been out of sorts the past couple of months. Some people are worried about growing competition from multi-channel cable systems."

Carlton, which controls the franchise for one of Britain's terrestrial television channels and is part of a digital broadcasting consortium with Granada Group Plc and British Sky Broadcasting Group Plc, reached a closing high of 575p on February 3.
But Britain's Independent Television Commission has yet to award licences to operate digital terrestrial TV frequencies.

The Carlton consortium faces competition from cable company International CableTel Inc in its bid to offer "multiplex" channel packages which include home shopping, banking, and Internet access as well as films and entertainment.
